attributes.comment:
We would like you to reconsider raising the cost of:
1.) Biometrics (fingerprints) from $70 to $80 per person, and
2.) the I-600A from $545 to $670.

With the extended ?wait? timeline for most international adoptions - most family will
have to reapply for a I-600A to file a new 171H to allow our internationally adopted
children into the United States. We have absolutely no control over another
countries timeline. We do not feel the U.S. government should penalize us
because of the expiration of the 171H while we wait for another country to play
their political games with us.

The decision to adopt a child is often discarded because of the financial burden
required of families. The average American who is interested in adopting a
baby/child is not wealthy. The average cost to adopt an international child is
approximately $25,000 ? $40,000. This is a significant financial hardship to an
American family. Why is it necessary to keep raising the cost of the biometrics
and I-600A for families who are still waiting for their adoption to be finalized.

In addition, please consider creating a clause to lengthen the 171H expiration
timeframe for those families who have dossier?s on file and are waiting the referral
of their baby/child.

Thank You for your reconsideration to incur this financial hardship upon us during
this greatly anticipated journey to adopt our daughter from China.

Sincerely,

Lee & Melissa Rector

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Lee & Melissa Rector
